intro: Leontice oliveri, commonly known as the Sicilian leontice, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
